page.title: 07LONG LAWFORD V
page.content:
Housing & Buildings
The housing in Long Lawford is neither exceptionally old or new. The oldest building in the village is the church, followed by a small terrace of old houses called the Laurel Cottages completed in 1885. These, however, are exceptions, as are the houses near Round Avenue still under construction. To begin with the village consisted of mostly private houses centred around three major streets. Many of the houses were built after the war, under a plan by the poor Goverement to put up many council and prefabricated houses due to the demand for homes.Strangely enough only six prefabricated houses were built and concentration went to more permanent council-owned dwellings.
